sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The examinacion of the constaunt martir of Christ, Ioh[a]n Philpot arch diacon of Winchestre at sondry seasons in the tyme of his sore emprisonment, conuented and banted, as in these particular tragedies folowyng, it maye (not only to the christen instruction, but also to the mery recreacion of the indifferent reader) most manifestly appeare. Reade fyrst and than iudge. Philpot, John, 1516-1555.
128, [44] leaves
E. van der Erve, [Emden : 1556?]
Imprint from STC. In two parts. Part 2, An apologie of Iohan Philpot written for spitting vpon an Arrian has half title. Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
=======

Reade fyrst and than iudge. Philpot, John, 1516-1555.

E. van der Erve, [Emden : 1556?]
